title: Extrarakeback

comments.author: DireWolfM14
comments.body: Quote from: Extrarakeback on October 14, 2022, 07:45:05 AMNeed 200usd Paypal friernd and family I have ltc or paypal 1:1I recommend you stop using PayPal for bitcoin trades. ¬†The risk of chargebacks will last for months after the deal is done, and bitcoin sellers almost always get screwed. ¬†It's also very common for PayPal funds to originate from stolen credit cards, which gives you absolutely no recourse. ¬†Zelle is much safer due the fact the funds originate from a funded bank account. ¬†Although there's still a risk of charge backs, the risk is mitigated to some extent.Also, the best place to do these kinds of trades is Bisq, I suggest you familiarize yourself with it and use that platform. ¬†Most 1:1 trade offers get taken within hours, and because of the way Bisq works it tends to mitigate the risk of being scammed.https://bisq.network/getting-started/Quote from: alterra57 on October 14, 2022, 10:57:20 AMWhy would anyone do this nonsensical trade with you, not only is there no money to be made but there's money to be lost?Why do you assume that every trade needs to be profitable? ¬†This is a discussion forum, not your personal business platform. ¬†If one person makes a profit the other suffers a loss, but the OP states clearly he's looking for a 1:1 trade, and if both parties use a US based PayPal account there are no fees for either party. ¬†Sounds pretty darn fair to me.

comments.author: Extrarakeback
comments.body: @DireWolfM14¬† thank you for your advice u really appreciate what you saying and is truthIm not a trader but i need paypal sometimes also i ask friend and family to avoid this charge back.someexchabgers or reputable excgangers ask for KYC todo this trade so thats why i came here . Anyway thank you again

comments.author: DireWolfM14
comments.body: Quote from: Extrarakeback on October 14, 2022, 09:42:00 PM@DireWolfM14¬† thank you for your advice u really appreciate what you saying and is truthIm not a trader but i need paypal sometimes also i ask friend and family to avoid this charge back.someexchabgers or reputable excgangers ask for KYC todo this trade so thats why i came here . Anyway thank you again No problem, I hope I was helpful.¬† That's one of the reasons I use and recommend Bisq; no KYC, no accounts to register.¬† The software works over the tor network and uses a peer to peer connection so there are no servers that store any of your personal information.¬† Essentially that's the same way bitcoin works, so it's nice to have a trading platform that adheres to the same philosophy.¬† Best of luck.

comments.author: msig1
comments.body: FYI. I offered to buy BTC by Paypal from this trader but he declined, the reason was that I was a newbie. I recommended that he protects himself with some escrow service and made it clear that I was going to pay the Paypal fees and that I was protecting myself with Paypal goods and services.

comments.author: GxSTxV
comments.body: There's a lot of exchangers on web trusted and secure to a safe trade. Choose an exchanger with less fees and look at reviews of people. I don't want to mention onenof the exchangers i use. But if you have a debit card you can do a p2p trade on binance wirh escrow.Here you may get a lot of scammers willing to take your money. If you ever trade with them use an escrow or any trusted members here with good profile and green trust. It's an advice from my experience in trading funds especially paypal

I got no limit of thai SIM cards so I can open accounts. (Now I bet somebody gonna complain and say it risky and bad blablablablablabla)But its totally safe without any risk whatsoever.
